required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Doravirine/Islatravir (DOR/ISL) in Adolescents With Human Immunodeficiency Virus Type 1 (HIV-1), ≥12 to <18 Years of Age and ≥35 kg (MK-8591A-028)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2 Clinical Study to Evaluate the Pharmacokinetics, Safety, and Efficacy of Doravirine/Islatravir in Adolescents With HIV-1 Infection Who Are Virologically Suppressed, Are ≥12 to <18 Years of Age, and Weigh ≥35 kg

brief_summary.textblock: This is a phase 2, single-group, multi-site, open-label study of an islatravir/doravirine (ISL/DOR, MK-8591A) fixed dose combination (FDC) for the treatment of human immunodeficiency virus type 1 (HIV-1) infection in adolescents who are virologically suppressed on antiretroviral therapy (ART) for ≥3 months. The primary purposes of the study are to examine the pharmacokinetics (PK) of steady-state ISL and DOR in plasma and ISL-triphosphate (ISL-TP) in peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs), and to examine the safety and tolerability of ISL/DOR.

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the plasma drug concentration-time curve from 0 to 24 hours post-dose (AUC0-24) of islatravir (ISL)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, and 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, and 24 hours post-dose on Day 28
primary_outcome.description: The AUC0-24 of ISL in plasma will be determined at steady state.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, and 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, and 24 hours post-dose on Day 28
primary_outcome.description: The Cmax of ISL in plasma will be determined at steady state.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to reach maximum plasma concentration (Tmax) of ISL
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, and 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, and 24 hours post-dose on Day 28
primary_outcome.description: The Tmax of ISL in plasma will be determined at steady state.

primary_outcome.measure: Apparent total clearance from plasma (CL/F) of ISL
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, and 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, and 24 hours post-dose on Day 28
primary_outcome.description: The CL/F of ISL from plasma will be determined at steady state.

primary_outcome.measure: Apparent volume of distribution during terminal phase (Vz/F) of ISL
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, and 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, and 24 hours post-dose on Day 28
primary_outcome.description: The Vz/F of ISL will be determined at steady state.

primary_outcome.measure: Apparent plasma terminal half-life (t½) of ISL
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, and 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, and 24 hours post-dose on Day 28
primary_outcome.description: The t½ of ISL in plasma will be determined at steady state.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, and 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, and 24 hours post-dose on Day 28
primary_outcome.description: The AUC0-24 of DOR in plasma will be determined at steady state.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, and 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, and 24 hours post-dose on Day 28
primary_outcome.description: The Cmax of DOR in plasma will be determined at steady state.

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentration at 24 hours post-dose (C24) of DOR
primary_outcome.description: The C24 of DOR in plasma will be determined at steady state.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, and 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, and 24 hours post-dose on Day 28
primary_outcome.description: The Tmax of DOR in plasma will be determined at steady state.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, and 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, and 24 hours post-dose on Day 28
primary_outcome.description: The CL/F of DOR in plasma will be determined at steady state.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, and 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, and 24 hours post-dose on Day 28
primary_outcome.description: The Vz/F of DOR in plasma will be determined at steady state.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, and 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, and 24 hours post-dose on Day 28
primary_outcome.description: The t½ of DOR in plasma will be determined at steady state.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, and 4 and 24 hours post-dose on Day 28
primary_outcome.description: The AUC0-24 of ISL-TP in PBMCs will be determined at steady state.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, and 4, and 24 hours post-dose on Day 28
primary_outcome.description: The Cmax of ISL-TP in PBMCs will be determined at steady state.
The C24 of ISL-TP in PBMCs will be determined at steady state.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants experiencing ≥1 adverse event (AE)
primary_outcome.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical study participant, temporally associated with the use of study intervention, whether or not considered related to the study intervention.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants discontinuing from study treatment due to an AE
primary_outcome.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical study participant, temporally associated with the use of study intervention, whether or not considered related to the study intervention.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants experiencing ≥1 adverse event (AE)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to at least 48 weeks (through study duration)
secondary_outcome.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical study participant, temporally associated with the use of study intervention, whether or not considered related to the study intervention.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants discontinuing from study treatment due to an AE
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to at least 48 weeks (through study duration)
secondary_outcome.description: An AE is any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical study participant, temporally associated with the use of study intervention, whether or not considered related to the study intervention.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants with human immunodeficiency virus type 1 (HIV-1) ribonucleic acid (RNA) ≥50 copies/mL
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants with HIV-1 RNA ≥50 copies/mL will be determined at the central laboratory with an Abbott Real Time Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) assay with a lower limit of detection (LLOD) of 40 copies/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants with HIV-1 RNA ≥50 copies/mL
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants with HIV-1 RNA ≥50 copies/mL will be determined at the central laboratory with an Abbott Real Time PCR assay with a LLOD of 40 copies/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants with HIV-1 RNA <50 copies/mL
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants with HIV-1 RNA <50 copies/mL will be determined at the central laboratory with an Abbott Real Time PCR assay with a LLOD of 40 copies/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants with HIV-1 RNA <50 copies/mL
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants with HIV-1 RNA <50 copies/mL will be determined at the central laboratory with an Abbott Real Time PCR assay with a LLOD of 40 copies/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in cluster of differentiation 4+ (CD4+) T-cells
secondary_outcome.description: CD4+ T-cell counts will be measured by a central laboratory.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in CD4+ T-cells
secondary_outcome.description: CD4+ T-cell counts will be measured by a central laboratory.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of viral drug resistance to DOR
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to at least 48 weeks (through study duration)
secondary_outcome.description: The incidence of viral drug resistance to DOR will be determined.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of viral drug resistance to ISL
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to at least 48 weeks (through study duration)
secondary_outcome.description: The incidence of viral drug resistance to ISL will be determined.

arm_group.description: Adolescent participants with HIV-1 infection receive DOR/ISL for 48 weeks.

intervention.description: 100 mg DOR/0.75 mg ISL FDC tablet taken once daily by mouth.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Is HIV-1 positive and weighs ≥35 kg at screening.
- Has been receiving continuous, stable oral 2-drug or 3-drug combinative antiretroviral therapy (cART) ± pharmacokinetic (PK) booster with documented viral suppression for ≥3 months prior to signing informed consent/assent.
- If female, is not pregnant or breastfeeding, and is either 1) not a woman of childbearing potential (WOCBP) or 2) is a WOCBP and is using acceptable contraception or is abstinent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Has HIV-2 infection.
- Has hypersensitivity or other contraindication to any of the components of the study drugs as determined by the investigator.
- Has an active diagnosis of hepatitis due to any cause, including active hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection (defined as hepatitis B surface antigen [HBsAg]-positive or HBV deoxyribonucleic acid [DNA] positive).
- Has a history of malignancy ≤5 years prior to signing informed consent except for adequately treated basal cell or squamous cell skin cancer, in situ cervical cancer, or cutaneous Kaposi's sarcoma.
- Has a history or current evidence of any condition (including active tuberculosis infection), therapy, laboratory abnormality or other circumstance (including drug or alcohol use or dependence) that might, in the opinion of the investigator, confound the results of the study or interfere with the participant's participation for the full duration of the study, such that it is not in the best interest of the participant to participate.
- Is taking or is anticipated to require systemic immunosuppressive therapy, immune modulators, or any prohibited therapies from 45 days prior to Day 1 through the study treatment period.
- Is currently taking long-acting cabotegravir-rilpivirine.
- Is currently participating in or has participated in an interventional clinical study with an investigational compound or device from 45 days prior to Day 1 through the study treatment period.
- Has a documented or known virologic resistance to DOR.
- Has exclusionary laboratory values.
- Is female and expecting to conceive or donate eggs at any time during the study.
